longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and/or passport replacing documents must be valid
  for at least 6 months beyond the period of intended stay.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 3 months:
 - for nationals of Argentina; 
Visa required, except for Holders of documents that prove
place of birth to be in Guyana (e.g. passport or Birth
Certificate).
Visa Issuance:
- Holders of confirmation, issued by the Ministry of Home
  Affairs, of a pre-arranged business, employment or student
  visa can obtain their visa on arrival. Fee: USD 140.-.
Minors:
- Visa not required for foreign minors (up to/incl. 17 years
  of age) born to nationals of Guyana,
  
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents required for their next
  destination. (SEE NOTE 44676)  
    NOTE 44676: Not applicable to CARICOM employees, guests
   and their families.
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward ticket could be refused
  entry. (SEE NOTE 44676)  
    NOTE 44676: Not applicable to CARICOM employees, guests
   and their families
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here (not required if arriving
from Argentina, Paraguay, Suriname or Trinidad and Tobago).

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age.
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit area.
Warning:
- Passengers not holding a yellow fever certificate, if
  required, will not be allowed to disembark. 
Recommended:
- Vaccination against yellow fever for all passengers.
  Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk (P. vivax and P.
  falciparum) is high throughout the year in all parts of the
  interior. Sporadic cases of malaria have been reported from
  the densely populated coastal belt. Recommended prevention
  in risk areas: C.
